members.name: getLabel
members.comment: Returns the human-readable name of the setting associated with this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "Threshold").

return: the label for this setting, not null

members.name: getName
members.comment: Returns the name of the setting associated with this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "threshold").

return: the name of this setting, not null

members.name: getDescription
members.comment: Returns the description of the setting associated this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "The duration an event must exceed to be be recorded").

return: the description of this setting, not null

members.name: getTypeName
members.comment: Returns the type name of the setting associated this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "jdk.settings.Threshold"). The type can be used to identify what type of setting this is.

return: the name of this settings type, not null

members.name: getContentType
members.comment: Returns the content type of the setting associated this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "jdk.jfr.Timespan"). The content type can be used to determine how the setting should be rendered in a graphical user interface.

return: the name of this settings type, not null

members.name: getDefaultValue
members.comment: Returns the default value of the setting associated this SettingDescriptorInfo (for example, "20 ms").

return: default value for this setting, not null

members.name: from
members.comment: Returns an SettingDescriptorInfo represented by the specified CompositeData The supplied CompositeData must have the following item names and item types to be valid. The name and type the specified CompositeData must contain Name Type name String label String description String typeName String contentType String defaultValue String

throws: IllegalArgumentException - if cd does not represent a valid EventTypeInfo

members.name: toString
members.comment: Returns a String description of this SettingDescriptorInfo.

return: a string describing this setting, not null

name: jdk.management.jfr.SettingDescriptorInfo
comment: Management class that describes a setting, for example name, description and default value.
